soot.jimple.infoflow.problems

Class AbstractInfoflowProblem

  • java.lang.Object
    • heros.template.DefaultIFDSTabulationProblem<soot.Unit,D,soot.SootMethod,I>
      • soot.jimple.toolkits.ide.DefaultJimpleIFDSTabulationProblem<Abstraction,soot.jimple.toolkits.ide.icfg.BiDiInterproceduralCFG<soot.Unit,soot.SootMethod>>
        • soot.jimple.infoflow.problems.AbstractInfoflowProblem
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    heros.IFDSTabulationProblem<soot.Unit,Abstraction,soot.SootMethod,soot.jimple.toolkits.ide.icfg.BiDiInterproceduralCFG<soot.Unit,soot.SootMethod>>, heros.SolverConfiguration
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BackwardsInfoflowProblem, BackwardTaintingProblem, BackwardTaintingProblemForHeap, InfoflowProblem, PairingInfoflowProblem

    public abstract class AbstractInfoflowProblem
extends soot.jimple.toolkits.ide.DefaultJimpleIFDSTabulationProblem<Abstraction,soot.jimple.toolkits.ide.icfg.BiDiInterproceduralCFG<soot.Unit,soot.SootMethod>>
    abstract super class which - concentrates functionality used by InfoflowProblem and BackwardsInfoflowProblem - contains helper functions which should not pollute the naturally large InfofflowProblems

      • setStopAfterFirstFlow

        public void setStopAfterFirstFlow(boolean stopAfterFirstFlow)
        Sets whether the information flow analysis shall stop after the first flow has been found
        Parameters:
        stopAfterFirstFlow - True if the analysis shall stop after the first flow has been found, otherwise false.

      • setEnableImplicitFlows

        public void setEnableImplicitFlows(boolean enableImplicitFlows)
        Sets whether the solver shall consider implicit flows.
        Parameters:
        enableImplicitFlows - True if implicit flows shall be considered, otherwise false.

      • setEnableStaticFieldTracking

        public void setEnableStaticFieldTracking(boolean enableStaticFields)
        Sets whether the solver shall consider assignments to static fields.
        Parameters:
        enableStaticFields - True if assignments to static fields shall be tracked, otherwise false

      • setEnableExceptionTracking

        public void setEnableExceptionTracking(boolean enableExceptions)
        Sets whether the solver shall track taints over exceptions, i.e. throw new RuntimeException(secretData).
        Parameters:
        enableExceptions - True if taints in thrown exception objects shall be tracked.

      • setFlowSensitiveAliasing

        public void setFlowSensitiveAliasing(boolean flowSensitiveAliasing)
        Sets whether the solver shall use flow sensitive aliasing. This makes the analysis more precise, but also requires more time.
        Parameters:
        flowSensitiveAliasing - True if flow sensitive aliasing shall be used, otherwise false

      • setEnableTypeChecking

        public void setEnableTypeChecking(boolean enableTypeChecking)
        Sets whether type checking shall be done on casts and method calls
        Parameters:
        enableTypeChecking - True if type checking shall be performed, otherwise false

      • setIgnoreFlowsInSystemPackages

        public void setIgnoreFlowsInSystemPackages(boolean ignoreFlowsInSystemPackages)
        Sets whether flows starting or ending in system packages such as Android's support library shall be ignored.
        Parameters:
        ignoreFlowsInSystemPackages - True if flows starting or ending in system packages shall be ignored, otherwise false.

      • setInspectSources

        public void setInspectSources(boolean inspect)
        default: inspectSources is set to true, this means sources are analyzed as well. If inspectSources is set to false, then the analysis does not propagate values into the source method.
        Parameters:
        inspect - boolean that determines the inspectSource option

      • setInspectSinks

        public void setInspectSinks(boolean inspect)
        default: inspectSinks is set to true, this means sinks are analyzed as well. If inspectSinks is set to false, then the analysis does not propagate values into the sink method.
        Parameters:
        inspect - boolean that determines the inspectSink option

      • baseMatches

        protected boolean baseMatches(soot.Value baseValue,
                              Abstraction source)
        Checks whether the given base value matches the base of the given taint abstraction
        Parameters:
        baseValue - The value to check
        source - The taint abstraction to check
        Returns:
        True if the given value has the same base value as the given taint abstraction, otherwise false

      • baseMatchesStrict

        protected boolean baseMatchesStrict(soot.Value baseValue,
                                    Abstraction source)
        Checks whether the given base value matches the base of the given taint abstraction and ends there. So a will match a, but not a.x. Not that this function will still match a to a.*.
        Parameters:
        baseValue - The value to check
        source - The taint abstraction to check
        Returns:
        True if the given value has the same base value as the given taint abstraction and no further elements, otherwise false

      • isExecutorExecute

        protected boolean isExecutorExecute(soot.jimple.InvokeExpr ie,
                                    soot.SootMethod dest)
        Checks whether the given call is a call to Executor.execute() or AccessController.doPrivileged() and whether the callee matches the expected method signature
        Parameters:
        ie - The invocation expression to check
        dest - The callee of the given invocation expression
        Returns:
        True if the given invocation expression and callee are a valid call to Executor.execute() or AccessController.doPrivileged()
